officialTitle: Routine vs. Clinically-Directed Antibiotic Treatment in Snake Bite With Local Envenomation: a Randomised Controlled Trial
inclusionCriteria:
* Age 18-65 years
* History of snake bite with features of local envenomation with/without systemic features
* Less than 24 hours since bite, AND
* No prior antibiotic treatment
* Must have minimum age of 18 Years
* Must have maximum age of 65 Years
exclusionCriteria:
* Upper limb bites
* Multiple (\> 1) bites
* Wound manipulation
* Extensive local necrosis or blebs
* Seriously-ill patients with hypotension/capillary leak/life threatening bleeding.
* Suspected cobra bite, OR
* Pregnant/breast-feeding women
